details.body:
## Section 415(2)(b) ITEPA 2003 [EIM13280](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/eimanual/EIM13280.htm) explained that it is necessary to identify where the type of benefit being provided is dealt with in the benefits code.
### Benefit ### Cash equivalent instruction ### Notes
Use of a car. [EIM23015](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/eimanual/EIM23015.htm)
Car fuel [EIM25550](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/eimanual/EIM25550.htm)
Use of a van [EIM22700](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/eimanual/EIM22700.htm)
Medical benefits [EIM21760](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/eimanual/EIM21760.htm)
Beneficial loan facilities [EIM26101](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/eimanual/EIM26101.htm) The cash equivalent of the beneficial loan is also treated as interest paid and so may be available for relief, see [EIM13320](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/eimanual/EIM13320.htm).
Mobile telephone [EIM21780](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/eimanual/EIM21780.htm)
Other benefits [EIM21101](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/eimanual/EIM21101.htm) In particular assets placed at the taxpayer's disposal (except cars, mobile telephones and vans, which are dealt with above), see [EIM21615](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/eimanual/EIM21615.htm).
When the value is established, it is income of the year of receipt (see [EIM13100](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/eimanual/EIM13100.htm)).
